Name: Peasant
Description: "Ready for work!"; ...; "Work, again?"

Name: Craftsman
Description: +1\C for each Workshop; "I'm being repressed!"

Name: Priest
Description: +2\F for each Temple; "One ring to rule them all, one ring to find them. One ring to bring them all, ..."; "Sorry, wrong book."

Name: Ranger
Description: +1\M for each Castle; +1\F for each Temple; "You have my sword."

Name: Knight
Description: +2\M for each Castle; "Damn helmet, can't seem to get this thingâ€¦"

Name: Wizard
Description: You can play additional spell; "You shall not pass!"

Name: Monk
Description: Target one enemy non-artifact creature, which becomes yours; You must have sufficient cards limit; "Wololo."

Name: The Thief
Description: Won: permanently take one random played non-artifact card from the opponent; Lost: permanently give The Thief to the oponent

Name: The King
Description: At the end: pick two of \C/\M/\F; Exchange the two final values; "The king commands, the nation obeys."

Name: Workshop
Description: "Look, I'm an engineer, my time is valuable."

Name: Temple
Description: "In nomine Patris et Filii et Spiritus sancti."

Name: Castle
Description: "Draw bridge, machicolations, murder holes, hoardings, arrowslits, bartizans, embrasures, merlons, ..."

Name: Trebuchet
Description: Removes one enemy building; "I'm TNT! I'm dynamite!"

Name: Orc
Description: +1\M for each Orc; "The more orc you have, the more orc you get."

Name: Goblin
Description: +1\M for each Goblin; "Judge me by my size, do you?"

Name: Troglodyte
Description: "Twolobite, ... trilobite, ... troglodyte!"

Name: Dragon
Description: Removes one enemy creature; "Look, I made an obsidian."

Name: Minotaur
Description: +5\M if you have Maze; "I am not a cyclop. I have two eyes."

Name: The Maze
Description: +4\C for each enemy creature, if you have Minotaur; "There is great treasue at the end. There is great minotaur in the way."

Name: Centaur
Description: "How do you wear pants?"; "I dont."

Name: Druid
Description: "One tree, two trees, tree threes, ... three trees, ... I have to stop playing the dies, ... the dices ..."

Name: Ent
Description: +1\C +2\M for each Entwife; "You see, we lost the entwives."

Name: Entwife
Description: +2\C +1\M for each Ent; "I am right here, you dumb***."

Name: Wisp
Description: Posesses one enemy human/orc/dwarf creature; Possesed creature has their stats halved; "Eo, eo, eo."

Name: Sacred Grove
Description: +3\C for each enemy creature with non-zero \M; "Greatest civilizations are grown from the ashes of their foes."

Name: Miner
Description: +2\C for each Blacksmith; "The spirits of the earth guide me."; "You mean metal ores."; "Of course."

Name: Axedwarf
Description: +2\M for each Blacksmith; "Iâ€™m wasted on cross-country. We Dwarves are natural sprinters. Very dangerous over short distances."

Name: Blacksmith
Description: "Tailor for the wealthy."; ...; "I mean, ... for the dwarfs."; "For wealthy dwarfs."

Name: Bank
Description: "Gems and money is what makes a dwarf happy."

Name: Dwarf Fortress
Description: "Booze does all the work in forts."; "Dwarves are just booze exoskeletons."

Name: Oracle
Description: "You've already made the choice. You're here to understand why you've made it."

Name: Angel
Description: All own and enemy creatures have +1\F; "I saw the angel in the marble and carved until I set her free."

Name: Griffin
Description: Immune to all negative effects; "Stand straight, walk proud, have a little faith."

Name: Faerie
Description: Immune to all spels, own and enemy; "The fairest of them all."

Name: Titan
Description: Removes one enemy creature; "In the name of god, we fight."

Name: The God
Description: Your final \F is doubled; Your final \M and \C become zero; "The faith is absolute."

Name: Imp
Description: -1\F for each Sacrificial Shrine; "Caring for the fires is my pleasure."

Name: Harpy
Description: "I smell magic in the air."; "Or maybe barbecue."

Name: Succubus
Description: Posesses one enemy human/orc/dwarf creature; Possesed creature has their stats halved; "Pleasure beyond life."

Name: Cerberus
Description: First 3 enemy creatures have -2\M; "Left head: 'This way!'"; "Right head: 'No, that way!'"

Name: The Balrog
Description: You have to remove one own creature; The Balrog takes two from the cards limit

Name: Sacrificial Shrine
Description: "The fires are bright and full of screams."

Name: Skeleton
Description: +2\M for each Graveyard; "No guts, no gory."

Name: Zombie
Description: +2\M for each Tomb; "Humans check in. They don't check out."

Name: Vampire
Description: +2\M for each enemy non-undead creature; "I'm having a mid-death crisis."

Name: Lich
Description: All undead creatures have +1\M -1\F; "I always wanted to start my own religion... so I did!"

Name: Ghost
Description: All enemy non-undead creatures have -1\M; "I'm invisible, gaseous, and deadly."

Name: Spectre
Description: At the end: spectre's stats are replicated from another creature on the table, own or enemy, ignoring any effects on the target

Name: The Plague Rats
Description: All enemy non-undead creatures have half their \M converted to \F; "You may pray, but without breath you cannot fight."

Name: Graveyard
Description: At the end: add Skeleton for each remaining removed non-undead creature, own or enemy; These Skeletons bypass cards limit

Name: Tomb
Description: At the end: add Zombie for each remaining removed non-undead building, own or enemy; These Zombies bypass cards limit

Name: Holy Water
Description: +5\M if enemy has any undead; "Tastes like tap water."

Name: Mandolin
Description: +2\C if you have Book of Poems; "ğ„ ğ„°ğ†”ğ… ğ…—ğ…—ğ†•ğ„— ğ„½ğ„…ğ‡“ğ…¡ğ… ğ„¬ğ…£ğ„¬ğ†•ğ…—ğ…¯ğ†ªğ…  ğ„†ğ… ğ…ğ„½ğ… ğ…¡ğ…—ğ…¡ ğ†•ğ„¬ğ„¬ğ†¾ğ‡“ğ… ğ…¡ğ…¡ğ„‡ ğ†”ğ…ğ…—ğ„½ğ…—ğ… ğ…—ğ…ğ…"

Name: Book of Poems
Description: "Time doesnâ€™t heal wounds to make you forget."; "Time leaves you with a scar to remind you of how you bled."

Name: Book of Laments
Description: +5\C if held by an elf; "MassÃ« nÃ¡ romba i sÃºyanÃ«? AvÃ¡niÃ«r vÃ« mistÃ« orossÃ«, vÃ« sÃºlimÃ« lairenna. Var cenuva yÃ©ni sirala et Ã‹arello entula?"

Name: Tome of Knowledge
Description: +4 to the strongest stat; "Knowledge, in the right hands, is the most powerful of all things."

Name: Incantation Scroll
Description: You can play additional spell; "Malla, Eer, Dul, Aman, Shala, Ros, Ackra, Sheer, Thalla, Salthrak, Imar, Kalador, Anâ€™perath, Oâ€™sakana, Ferik, ..."

Name: Cloak of Invisibility
Description: The creature is protected from all enemy effects; "Definitely not used for peeping."

Name: Poison
Description: "The coward's weapon."

Name: Jewel
Description: Requires human, elf, or dwarf; "Antique ruby pendant with perfect diamond cut, flawless clarity and deep red color, 3 carats."

Name: Mushrooms
Description: Convert half of \M to \F; "Have you seen the dragon?"; "No, but I got touched by the god."

Name: Hookah
Description: Convert half of \F to \C; "Eternal Smoke Dark Bean"; "Social Smoke Berry Punch"; "Starbuzz Blue Mist"

Name: Duck
Description: The player who loses must quack, 3 times, loud and clear; "What does the duck say?"

Name: The Yoghurt
Description: "The only culture America makes."

Name: The Sword of Cruelty
Description: "Sharp blade, blunt mind."

Name: The Cutest Pet
Description: "Only the most evil person would give it as a gift to another creature instead of freeing it."

Name: Counterspell
Description: Must be played immediately after the enemy has played a spell; That enemy's spell is cancelled; Cannot use on Counterspell

Name: Lightning Bolt
Description: Removes one enemy non-divine creature; "Death as fast as light."

Name: Unholly Smite
Description: Removes one enemy non-demonic creature; "It promises great power, but it exacts a terrible price."

Name: Raise Undead
Description: You need Graveyard or Tomb to play this spell;Take one removed non-undead creature, own or enemy, and put it at your table as a Ghost; This Ghost bypasses cards limit

Name: Upside Down
Description: Target one creature, own or enemy; Its stats are multiplied by -1; "Alternate dimension that mirrors our world."

Name: Blessing
Description: Target one non-divine, non-demonic, non-undead creature, own or enemy; Its strongest stat is doubled

Name: Curse
Description: Target one non-divine, non-demonic, non-undead creature, own or enemy; Its strongest stat becomes zero; "Death is the only way to lift the curse."

Name: Doppelganger
Description: Target one creature; At the end: creates additional copy of that creature, with halved stats; The copied creature bypasses cards limit

Name: Illusion
Description: Target one building; At the end: creates additional copy of that building, with halved stats; The copied building bypasses cards limit

Name: Swap Positions
Description: Target one enemy non-artifact creature and one own creature; The two creatures are swapped, including equipped items and spells applied directly to them

Name: High Ground
Description: Target one creature; Its \M is doubled; "It is over, I have the high ground."

Name: Low Ground
Description: Target one enemy creature; Its \M is halved; "You underestimate my power."

Name: Time Slip
Description: Your oponent playes 3 turns in a row, then you play 3 turns in a row, then the game ends; Cannot play if Time Slip is already in effect

Name: Embers
Description: +1\M to all demonic creatures; -1\M to all elf enemy creatures; "Made in the hell, burns forever."

Name: Break
Description: Removes one item, own or enemy; "Your staff is broken."

Name: The Alembic Laboratory
Description: Convert all final \C to \M, at half rate; "Department of Gears and Tie Rods. ... Department of Bubling Solutions."

Name: The Conquerors Library
Description: Convert all final \M to \C, at half rate; "Embrace your curiosity and nothing is impossible."

Name: The House of Mirrors
Description: Your Doppelganger and Illusion create two copies of the target instead of one; "Each reflection more beautiful than the previous."
